overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-26, Sendo-labs/plugin-jupiter had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 1 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add referral fee support (Legacy Swap) + live E2E scripts, docs, and config
topPRs.author: MonteCrypto999
topPRs.body:
# PR: Optional Referral Fees on Jupiter Legacy Swap

This PR adds **optional referral fees** on *Jupiter Legacy Swap* via `platformFeeBps` and `feeAccount`,
with clean **env-based config**, **tests**, and **runnable E2E examples** (simulation/signing).

---

## üß© Features

### Referral Fees

* Adds `platformFeeBps` to `/quote` when `REFERRAL_FEE_BPS > 0`.
* Derives `feeAccount` as the **ATA for the chosen mint** from `REFERRAL_FEE_RECEIVER`.
* **Modes:**

  * `sol_only`: collect fees only if SOL/WSOL is in the pair.
  * `smart`: prefer SOL if available, else input mint.
* Respects **ExactIn / ExactOut** rules and skips fees if constraints aren‚Äôt met.

---

## üß† Code Changes

* **`src/service.ts`**

  * Integrates `platformFeeBps` in quote and `feeAccount` in swap.
  * Handles mint selection and fee receiver ATA derivation.
* **`src/__tests__/integration.test.ts`**

  * Live-mode tests against Jupiter API (referral on/off, custom mint sample).
* **`src/scripts/e2e-mainnet.ts`**

  * E2E script using `.env` (can simulate and sign/send).
* **`local-e2e/` (gitignored)**

  * Local simulator for build/quote/swap, simulate, and sign via **Helius RPC**.
* **Docs & Config**

  * `README.md` and `env.example`: updated with clear config and E2E instructions.
  * `.gitignore`: ignores `local-e2e` and env files.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How to Use

### 1. Setup Environment

Copy `.env.example` ‚Üí `.env` and set:

```bash
REFERRAL_FEE_BPS=20
REFERRAL_MODE=sol_only
REFERRAL_FEE_RECEIVER=<fee receiver public key>
TEST_INPUT_MINT=So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112
TEST_OUTPUT_MINT=Dz9mQ9NzkBcCsuGPFJ3r1bS4wgqKMHBPiVuniW8Mbonk
TEST_INPUT_AMOUNT_ATOMIC=5000000      # 0.005 SOL
TEST_SLIPPAGE_BPS=150
# Optional (for simulation/signing)
HELIUS_RPC_URL=<url>
SIGNER_SECRET_KEY=[‚Ä¶]
SEND_TX=0
```

---

### 2. Run E2E Example

```bash
npm run build && node dist/scripts/e2e-mainnet.js
```

---

### 3. Local Simulator (ignored, for ops/dev)

Populate `local-e2e/.env.local` as above, then run:

```bash
npm run local:sim
```

---

## üß© Notes & Edge Cases

* **Error ‚ÄúInvalid token account / 0x1789 (6025)‚Äù**
  Usually a route/account issue.
  Ensure the **fee receiver‚Äôs ATA exists** for the selected mint (e.g., WSOL in `sol_only` mode).
  If absent, create the ATA or let Jupiter create it idempotently.
  Some routes may still fail in simulation‚Äîtry higher slippage or another route.

* **No Referral Program needed** for Legacy Swap.
  (Still required for Trigger API.)

---

## üîó References

* [[Jupiter Docs ‚Äì Add Fees to Swap](https://dev.jup.ag/docs/swap/add-fees-to-swap)](https://dev.jup.ag/docs/swap/add-fees-to-swap)
* [[ElizaOS ‚Äì Create a Plugin](https://docs.elizaos.ai/guides/create-a-plugin)](https://docs.elizaos.ai/guides/create-a-plugin)

---

## ‚úÖ Checklist

* [x] Referral fee applied only when `REFERRAL_FEE_BPS > 0` and valid `feeAccount`
* [x] `feeAccount` derived from `REFERRAL_FEE_RECEIVER` ATA for selected mint
* [x] Live integration tests against Jupiter API
* [x] E2E script with simulation/signing (HELIUS RPC)
* [x] `README` and `.env.example` updated
* [x] Local-only utilities ignored by git

topContributors.summary: standujar: Made a foundational contribution by delivering the initial implementation of the Sendo Worker in `Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker#1`, a significant effort involving over 13,000 lines of code. They also enhanced the `Sendo-labs/leaderboard` repository by adding new projects and JSON endpoints via PRs #3 and #4. Their activity shows a primary focus on feature work, bug fixes, and establishing test infrastructure.

Neysixx: Focused on significant refactoring and feature development in the Sendo-labs/frontend repository, landing several impactful changes. They executed a large-scale improvement to the page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3), refactored the worker-plugin (Sendo-labs/frontend#6), and resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This work demonstrates a primary focus on refactoring, which accounted for the majority of their code changes.

xdrkush: This week, xdrkush focused on resolving an issue within the `sendo-api` repository, merging PR #3 to address a bug in the buy/sell account functionality. This was a notable contribution with over 700 lines of changes across 17 files. Their work was evenly split between bug fixes and feature development, including updates to both application code and tests.

MonteCrypto999: Focused on a significant feature addition for the Jupiter plugin, opening a pull request to add referral fee support (Sendo-labs/plugin-jupiter#1). This large-scale effort introduced over 5,900 lines of code across 31 files. The work primarily involved feature implementation, configuration changes, and the addition of new tests.

M4XGO: Focused on improving project infrastructure by establishing automated release management and NPM publishing workflows in the Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore repository (PR #2). This work consisted entirely of modifications to configuration files, indicating a primary focus on tooling and deployment processes.

tionebDotsamapha: This week's focus was on improving project documentation, merging a pull request in Sendo-labs/sendo-api (#2) to update the README file. Their contributions were entirely focused on documentation.
